meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Put the raspberries in a pan with the sugar and vinegar. Mash over a low heat for 10 mins until smooth and syrupy. Rub through a sieve into a clean pan."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Tip the seeds from the sieve into a bowl and stir in 300ml water, then sieve again to remove the last of the pulp from seeds. Pour the liquid into the pan with the sieved pulp, stir well and boil for 1 min. Pour into small sterilised bottles and seal. The cordial will keep unopened for a few months. Once opened, store in the fridge."}]
ing_group: [{"ing_group":"500g raspberry"},{"ing_group":"500g caster sugar"},{"ing_group":"3 tbsp red wine vinegar"}]

meth_list: [{"meth_list":"STEP 1"},{"meth_list":"Put the potatoes in a pan, cover with water, add 1 tsp salt and bring to the boil. Cook for 12-15 mins or until tender enough to smash. Leave to cool."},{"meth_list":"STEP 2"},{"meth_list":"Heat 1 tbsp of the oil in a frying pan and add the fennel seeds, fennel, chilli and garlic followed by the spring onions. Gently cook for 3-5 mins until fragrant but not coloured. During the last minute, add the samphire."},{"meth_list":"STEP 3"},{"meth_list":"In a bowl, mash the potatoes until well broken down, then combine with the crabmeat, herbs, spring onion mix, cayenne, lemon zest and mayo. Season and mix until well combined, then chill for 30 mins."},{"meth_list":"STEP 4"},{"meth_list":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Oil your hands and shape the mixture into eight palm-sized patties and dip in plenty of flour. Be careful, as they are quite fragile and sticky – a good way to do this is on a tray lined with baking parchment. If you have time, put in the fridge to set for 30 mins before cooking. Heat the remaining oil in a non-stick frying pan and fry for 2-3 mins on each side until crisp and golden. Transfer to an oiled baking tray and finish in the oven for 5 mins. Serve with mayo, some watercress tossed with the remaining herbs, and the lemon juice with the lemon wedges on the side."}]

name: Pineapple & pork skewers
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Cut the pork into cubes. Heat the sugar and vinegar in a pan over a low heat until the sugar melts. Add the fish sauce and cool. name: Strawberry shortcake slice
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Line a 20cm cake tin or dish (either a square or rectangle works well) with cling film, leaving an overhang. Whip 500ml of the cream, the vanilla, orange blossom water and 125g icing sugar with an electric whisk until thick and billowy."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Add a layer of biscuits to the tin, and spoon over some of the cream, about 1cm thick all over. Add a layer of strawberry slices, then repeat with the cream, biscuits and strawberries until you fill the tin, finishing on a layer of biscuit. You’ll have some strawberries left over to serve. Press everything down well so every biscuit is covered in cream. Cover and chill overnight."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"To serve, flip the tin onto a serving plate, and remove the cling film. Whip the remaining 100ml cream with 1 tbsp icing sugar and dollop on top of the cake, swirling it around. Top with the remaining strawberry slices in lines, sift over the remaining 1 tbsp icing sugar, and sprinkle the biscuit crumbs in between the rows of strawberries. Cut into slices to serve."}]

name: Lemon & yogurt chicken flatbreads
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Put the chicken in a bowl. Pare strips of zest from the lemon using a vegetable peeler, then juice the lemon too. Add the peel and half the juice to the chicken, along with the oregano (if using), garlic, cinnamon and oil. Mix well, cover and chill for an hour. The lemon juice will start to ‘cook’ the chicken, so don’t leave for longer."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Heat the barbecue. If you are using coals, wait until they turn white. If you are indoors, heat a griddle pan. Thread the chicken strips onto a couple of metal skewers to stop them falling through the grate (you don’t need to do this for the griddle), then grill for a couple of mins each side. The strips will cook through quickly so don’t leave them too long. Season if you like."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Warm the flatbreads on the edge of the barbecue (or on the griddle) for a minute, then transfer them to plates and spread each with ½ tbsp yogurt. Divide the chicken strips between them, then dot on the remaining yogurt and sprinkle over the pepper and lettuce. Fold or roll the flatbreads to eat."}]
ing_group: [{"ing_group":"2 skinless chicken breasts , cut into strips"},{"ing_group":"1 lemon"},{"ing_group":"1 tsp dried oregano (optional)"},{"ing_group":"1 garlic clove , crushed"},{"ing_group":"pinch of cinnamon"},{"ing_group":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ing_group":"4 flatbreads"},{"ing_group":"4 tbsp Greek yogurt"},{"ing_group":"¼ red pepper , finely chopped"},{"ing_group":"1 Little Gem lettuce , finely chopped"}]

meth_list: [{"meth_list":"STEP 1"},{"meth_list":"Heat the oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Oil two 20cm, loose-bottomed cake tins and line the bottom of each one with baking parchment."},{"meth_list":"STEP 2"},{"meth_list":"Sieve the flour into a large mixing bowl, and add 1/2 tsp salt and the baking powder. Stir through the sugar, cinnamon, cardamom and a very good grating of nutmeg. In a separate bowl, whisk the mashed bananas through the eggs and oil until well combined. Make a well in the centre of the dry ingredients and tip in the wet mixture. Fold everything together until combined, then mix through the pineapple and pecans. Spoon the mixture into the tins and bake in the centre of the oven for 35-45 mins or until a skewer inserted into the middle comes out clean. Leave to cool in the tins for about 10 mins before transferring to a wire rack to cool down completely."},{"meth_list":"STEP 3"},{"meth_list":"Meanwhile, put the soft cheese, softened butter, honey and sugar into a mixing bowl and beat together until just combined. Try not to overbeat the mixture or it will become too soft and runny. Chill for 30 mins in the fridge before using."},{"meth_list":"STEP 4"},{"meth_list":"Put one of the cakes on a serving plate and spread with half the icing. Top with the other cake and smooth over the remaining icing. Finish with shavings of orange zest, edible flowers and dried pineapple rings, if you like. Will keep in an airtight container for up to three days."}]

recip: Summer egg salad with basil & peas
name: Summer egg salad with basil & peas
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Cook the potatoes in a pan of simmering water for 5 mins. Add the beans and cook 5 mins more, then tip in the peas and cook for 2 mins until all the vegetables are just tender. Meanwhile, boil the eggs in another pan for 8 mins. Drain and run under cold water, then carefully shell and halve."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Mix all the dressing ingredients together in a large bowl with a good grinding of black pepper, crushing the herbs and capers with the back of a spoon to intensify their flavours."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Mix the warm vegetables into the dressing to coat, then add the lettuce and toss everything together. Pile onto plates, top with the eggs and grind over some black pepper to serve."}]
ing_group: [{"ing_group":"150g new potatoes , thickly sliced"},{"ing_group":"160g French beans , trimmed"},{"ing_group":"160g frozen peas"},{"ing_group":"3 eggs"},{"ing_group":"160g romaine lettuce , roughly torn into pieces"},{"ing_group":"1 tbsp extra virgin olive oil"},{"ing_group":"2 tsp cider vinegar"},{"ing_group":"½ tsp English mustard powder"},{"ing_group":"2 tbsp chopped mint"},{"ing_group":"3 tbsp chopped basil"},{"ing_group":"1 garlic clove , finely grated"},{"ing_group":"1 tbsp capers"}]

name: Gin & tonic cheesecake
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Butter and line a 23cm loose-bottomed tin with baking parchment. Put the digestive biscuits in a plastic food bag and crush to crumbs using a rolling pin, or blitz in a food processor. Transfer to a bowl, then pour over the melted butter. Mix thoroughly until the crumbs are completely coated. Tip them into the prepared tin and press firmly down into the base to create an even layer. Chill in the fridge for 1 hr to set firmly."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"To make the filling, place the cream cheese, icing sugar and lime zest in a bowl, then beat with an electric whisk until smooth. Tip in the gin and double cream, and continue beating until the mixture is thick and completely combined. Now spoon it onto the biscuit base, and spread to the edges. Smooth the top of the cheesecake down with the back of a dessert spoon or spatula. Leave to set in the fridge overnight."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Pour the can of gin and tonic into a pan, add the caster sugar and lemon juice and boil hard. Once it has reduced to a syrup (about 3-4 minutes over high heat), cool a little, then add the lime juice and the slices of lemon and toss in the syrup. Allow to cool completely."},{"meth_group":"STEP 4"},{"meth_group":"To serve, place the base of the cheesecake on top of a can, then gradually pull the sides of the tin down. Slip the cake onto a serving plate, removing the lining paper and base. Top with a handful of the crushed meringues, then drizzle with the syrup, scattering the lemon slices on top as you go. Add a final dusting of lime zest, slice and serve."}]
ing_group: [{"ing_group":"250g digestive biscuits"},{"ing_group":"100g butter , melted"},{"ing_group":"600g cream cheese"},{"ing_group":"100g icing sugar"},{"ing_group":"zest and juice of 1 lime , plus extra zest to serve"},{"ing_group":"50ml gin"},{"ing_group":"280ml double cream"},{"ing_group":"250ml can gin and tonic"},{"ing_group":"2 tbsp caster sugar"},{"ing_group":"1 lemon , half juiced, half finely sliced"},{"ing_group":"2 medium meringues , crushed"}]

meth_list: [{"meth_list":"STEP 1"},{"meth_list":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Unroll 1 pastry sheet, but leave it on the parchment. Place it on a baking tray, dust with 2 tbsp icing sugar, then cover with another sheet of parchment and another baking tray. Pour baking beans into the tray to weigh it down, or use empty cans. Bake for 30 mins, then check if the pastry is golden all over. If not, return for another 5 mins or so. Repeat with the other pastry sheet (or cook both together if you have enough trays). Once out of the oven, trim the edges with a large, sharp knife. Leave to cool."},{"meth_list":"STEP 2"},{"meth_list":"Softly whip the mascarpone, cream, vanilla and remaining icing sugar, then transfer half to a disposable piping bag fitted with a 1.5cm round nozzle (or just snip off the corner). Pipe blobs of the mascarpone cream over the surface of one piece of pastry, right up to the edges. Top with half the fruit and dust with a little icing sugar."},{"meth_list":"STEP 3"},{"meth_list":"Top with the second piece of pastry, more mascarpone cream (refilling the bag when you need to), the remaining fruit, a dusting of icing sugar and, finally, some mint leaves. Use a serrated knife to cut through the layers without squashing the whole tart. Best served within an hour or two, but leftovers will keep for up to two days in the fridge."}]

recip: Sweet potatoes with red pepper & halloumi
name: Sweet potatoes with red pepper & halloumi
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Rub each potato with a little oil and salt, then wrap in a double layer of foil."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Pour the oil into a bowl and stir in the mint. Add the halloumi and toss until well coated in the minty oil. Wrap each piece in a strip of pepper. Cut four lengths of foil about 1cm wide and wrap one around the middle of each parcel to hold them together. You could use skewers instead, but be careful not to split the cheese."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Heat the barbecue. When the coals glow red, put the potatoes directly on them. Cook for 30 mins, turning halfway. Unwrap a potato and check if it is cooked through. If not, rewrap and cook more, checking every 10 mins. Alternatively, bake in the oven at 200C/180C fan/gas 6 for 50 mins-1 hr."},{"meth_group":"STEP 4"},{"meth_group":"Meanwhile cook the pepper parcels on the barbecue or a griddle pan for 3-4 mins each side or until the pepper chars and the cheese melts a bit. Remove from the grill and unwind the foil or remove the skewers. Split the potatoes, add butter if you like, then lay a parcel in the centre of each. Transfer to a parchment-lined tray and freeze for at least 2 hrs."},{"meth_list":"STEP 2"},{"meth_list":"Heat enough oil to come 2-3cm up the side of a saucepan. name: Tomato, burrata & broad bean salad
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Chop the tomatoes into a mixture of slices and wedges, then put them in a bowl. name: Fennel, roast lemon & tomato salad
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6 and line a baking tray with baking parchment. Slice 1 lemon into thin rounds and spread out on the baking tray, drizzle over 1/2 tbsp oil and sprinkle over the sugar. Roast for 20-25 mins until shrivelled and caramelised in places. Keep an eye on them – you may have to take some out the oven before the others are done. These can be made in the morning and kept at room temperature."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"While the lemons are cooking, roughly chop the tomatoes and thinly slice the fennel, saving the fronds. Put in a bowl with the remaining olive oil, juice from the other lemon and pomegranate seeds. Season to taste, then give everything a good mix."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"When you’re ready to serve, roughly chop all the herbs and mix them into the salad along with the roasted lemons and fennel fronds."}]

ingr_list: [{"ingr_list":"250g digestive biscuits"},{"ingr_list":"100g butter , melted"},{"ingr_list":"600g cream cheese"},{"ingr_list":"100g icing sugar"},{"ingr_list":"zest and juice of 1 lime , plus extra zest to serve"},{"ingr_list":"50ml gin"},{"ingr_list":"280ml double cream"},{"ingr_list":"250ml can gin and tonic"},{"ingr_list":"2 tbsp caster sugar"},{"ingr_list":"1 lemon , half juiced, half finely sliced"},{"ingr_list":"2 medium meringues , crushed"}]
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Butter and line a 23cm loose-bottomed tin with baking parchment. Put the digestive biscuits in a plastic food bag and crush to crumbs using a rolling pin, or blitz in a food processor. Transfer to a bowl, then pour over the melted butter. Mix thoroughly until the crumbs are completely coated. Tip them into the prepared tin and press firmly down into the base to create an even layer. Chill in the fridge for 1 hr to set firmly."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"To make the filling, place the cream cheese, icing sugar and lime zest in a bowl, then beat with an electric whisk until smooth. Tip in the gin and double cream, and continue beating until the mixture is thick and completely combined. Now spoon it onto the biscuit base, and spread to the edges. Smooth the top of the cheesecake down with the back of a dessert spoon or spatula. Leave to set in the fridge overnight."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Pour the can of gin and tonic into a pan, add the caster sugar and lemon juice and boil hard. Once it has reduced to a syrup (about 3-4 minutes over high heat), cool a little, then add the lime juice and the slices of lemon and toss in the syrup. Allow to cool completely."},{"meth_group":"STEP 4"},{"meth_group":"To serve, place the base of the cheesecake on top of a can, then gradually pull the sides of the tin down. Slip the cake onto a serving plate, removing the lining paper and base. Top with a handful of the crushed meringues, then drizzle with the syrup, scattering the lemon slices on top as you go. Add a final dusting of lime zest, slice and serve."}]

meth_list: [{"meth_list":"STEP 1"},{"meth_list":"Toss the chicken in the soy sauce, sesame oil and ginger. Chill until you’re ready to cook. Mix the ingredients for the glaze."},{"meth_list":"STEP 2"},{"meth_list":"Heat the BBQ. If using a coal BBQ, wait for the coals to turn ashen before you start cooking. Cook the kebab for 5-8 mins on each side (depending on the heat). Once nicely charred but not fully cooked through, start painting on the glaze. The honey will catch if cooked for too long – the key to nice sticky chicken is applying the glaze in layers, turning the kebab often."},{"meth_list":"STEP 3"},{"meth_list":"Once the glaze has been used up and the chicken is cooked through (it’ll take about 20 mins in total), transfer to a plate and leave to cool for 5 mins before serving scattered with spring onions."}]

meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Heat the oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Heat the oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Unroll the pastry and briefly roll out on a lightly floured work surface until it's large enough to fit a 23cm loose-bottomed tart tin. Trim this away, leaving just a small amount of excess hanging over the rim."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Line the pastry with baking parchment and fill with baking beans or uncooked rice. Leave to cool until just warm before slicing and serving with custard."}]

recip: Summer berry cake with rose geranium cream
name: Summer berry cake with rose geranium cream
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Butter and line the bases of three 23cm cake tins. Cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy, then add the almond extract and lemon zest. Use a fork to whisk the yogurt with the eggs. With the mixer on a low speed, add the flour, ground almonds and 1/2 tsp salt to the butter and sugar, alternating with the yogurt and eggs."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Divide the batter between the tins and bake for 35-40 mins or until a skewer inserted into the middle comes out clean. Cool in the tins for 5 mins, then turn out onto a wire rack, remove the parchment and leave to cool."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Beat the mascarpone to loosen it. Whip the cream until it holds its shape. Combine the cream, mascarpone and lemon juice, then carefully add the icing sugar and flower water to taste."},{"meth_group":"STEP 4"},{"meth_group":"Assemble the cake just before serving. Toss the berries with the caster sugar. Spread the flattest cake with half the cream, then add half the fruit. Top with a second cake, spread with the rest of the cream and top with the rest of the fruit. Finish with the last cake, sift over icing sugar, then decorate with rose geranium petals and rose geranium leaves (as long as they’re small)."}]
ing_group: [{"ing_group":"325g butter , at room temperature, plus extra for the tins"},{"ing_group":"425g caster sugar"},{"ing_group":"2 tsp almond extract"},{"ing_group":"½ lemon , finely zested"},{"ing_group":"250g plain yogurt"},{"ing_group":"4 large eggs , at room temperature"},{"ing_group":"375g self-raising flour"},{"ing_group":"225g ground almonds"},{"ing_group":"200g mascarpone"},{"ing_group":"300ml double cream"},{"ing_group":"1 tbsp lemon juice"},{"ing_group":"icing sugar , to taste, plus extra for dusting"},{"ing_group":"1-2 tsp rose geranium water or rose water, to taste (see tip, below)"},{"ing_group":"800g summer berries (raspberries, blackberries, redcurrants, blackcurrants, hulled strawberries and loganberries)"},{"ing_group":"4 tbsp caster sugar"},{"ing_group":"rose geranium flowers or other edible flowers"}]

name: Veggie rainbow picnic pie
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Toss the squash in 1 tbsp oil and some seasoning and roast for 20 mins until soft. Meanwhile, fry the onion in the remaining oil for 10-15 mins over a low heat until golden and boil the potatoes for 8 mins until soft. Drain the potatoes and leave the veg to cool."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Reduce oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Line a 20cm x 30cm baking tin with a long double thickness strip of parchment (this will help you to lift out the pie once cooked). Squeeze the two blocks of pastry together, then roll out on a floured surface – the pastry should be about the thickness of a £1 coin. Use the pastry to line the tin, leaving any excess pastry hanging over the edges."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Sprinkle the breadcrumbs over the base of the pastry. Layer in the beetroot slices, peppers, squash, onions, feta, potatoes, peas and herbs (in that order for a nice rainbow effect), seasoning well between each layer. Beat the eggs and pour slowly over the filling until most of it has sunk through the layers, saving a little to glaze the top. Brush some egg over the overhanging pastry then lay the rolled pastry sheet on top. Press the pastry sheets together, then use some kitchen scissors to trim the excess pastry, leaving about 2cm. Roll the edges in to seal, then press them firmly with a fork. Brush with egg, sprinkle with seeds, then use the fork prongs to mark out 12 portions. Bake for 1 hr 20 mins until the pastry is golden and crisp. Leave to cool completely before slicing, or chill for up to two days before serving."}]

recip: Swedish meatballs with beetroot & apple salad
ingr_list: [{"ingr_list":"500g lean pork mince (5% fat)"},{"ingr_list":"100g coarsely grated courgette , squeezed of excess juice"},{"ingr_list":"1 onion , grated"},{"ingr_list":"4 tbsp chopped fresh dill"},{"ingr_list":"2 garlic cloves , finely grated"},{"ingr_list":"1 egg"},{"ingr_list":"1 tbsp rapeseed oil"},{"ingr_list":"1 tsp thyme leaves"},{"ingr_list":"2 tsp vegetable bouillon powder , made up to 300ml with boiling water"},{"ingr_list":"2 tbsp half-fat crème fraîche"},{"ingr_list":"1 large apple , chopped"},{"ingr_list":"1 red onion , halved and thinly sliced"},{"ingr_list":"4 tbsp chopped parsley"},{"ingr_list":"2 tsp capers"},{"ingr_list":"½ lemon , juiced"},{"ingr_list":"320g cooked beetroot , cut into strips"}]
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"To make the meatballs, tip the pork into a bowl and add the grated courgette and onion, half the dill, half the garlic and plenty of black pepper. Break in the egg and mix well with your hands. When everything is well combined, break off walnut-size pieces and roll into balls – you should end up with about 28. The mixture will be very soft."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Heat the oil in a large non-stick frying pan then gently fry the meatballs in two batches until firm and pale golden, turning them every now and then so they brown evenly. Each batch should take 6-8 mins."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Wipe out the pan to remove excess fat and add the remaining garlic and thyme, then pour in the bouillon and bring to the boil. Turn off the heat, stir in the crème fraîche and remaining dill, then return the meatballs to the pan and turn them in the mixture until coated."},{"meth_group":"STEP 4"},{"meth_group":"For the salad, mix the apple, onion, parsley and capers with the lemon, then stir through the beetroot. Serve the salad alongside the meatballs. If you’re cooking for two people, eat half the meatballs and salad now, and chill the rest for another day – it will keep in the fridge for up to three days. Reheat the meatballs in the microwave until piping hot."}]

ingr_list: [{"ingr_list":"325g butter , at room temperature, plus extra for the tins"},{"ingr_list":"425g caster sugar"},{"ingr_list":"2 tsp almond extract"},{"ingr_list":"½ lemon , finely zested"},{"ingr_list":"250g plain yogurt"},{"ingr_list":"4 large eggs , at room temperature"},{"ingr_list":"375g self-raising flour"},{"ingr_list":"225g ground almonds"},{"ingr_list":"200g mascarpone"},{"ingr_list":"300ml double cream"},{"ingr_list":"1 tbsp lemon juice"},{"ingr_list":"icing sugar , to taste, plus extra for dusting"},{"ingr_list":"1-2 tsp rose geranium water or rose water, to taste (see tip, below)"},{"ingr_list":"800g summer berries (raspberries, blackberries, redcurrants, blackcurrants, hulled strawberries and loganberries)"},{"ingr_list":"4 tbsp caster sugar"},{"ingr_list":"rose geranium flowers or other edible flowers"}]
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Butter and line the bases of three 23cm cake tins. With the mixer on a low speed, add the flour, ground almonds and 1/2 tsp salt to the butter and sugar, alternating with the yogurt and eggs."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Divide the batter between the tins and bake for 35-40 mins or until a skewer inserted into the middle comes out clean. Squeeze the two blocks of pastry together, then roll out on a floured surface – the pastry should be about the thickness of a £1 coin. Use the pastry to line the tin, leaving any excess pastry hanging over the edges."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Sprinkle the breadcrumbs over the base of the pastry. Layer in the beetroot slices, peppers, squash, onions, feta, potatoes, peas and herbs (in that order for a nice rainbow effect), seasoning well between each layer. Beat the eggs and pour slowly over the filling until most of it has sunk through the layers, saving a little to glaze the top. Brush some egg over the overhanging pastry then lay the rolled pastry sheet on top. Press the pastry sheets together, then use some kitchen scissors to trim the excess pastry, leaving about 2cm. Roll the edges in to seal, then press them firmly with a fork. Brush with egg, sprinkle with seeds, then use the fork prongs to mark out 12 portions. Bake for 1 hr 20 mins until the pastry is golden and crisp. Leave to cool completely before slicing, or chill for up to two days before serving."}]
ing_group: [{"ing_group":"450g butternut squash , peeled, sliced and cut into small chunks"},{"ing_group":"2 tbsp olive or rapeseed oil"},{"ing_group":"1 large onion , sliced"},{"ing_group":"550g small waxy potatoes , peeled and sliced"},{"ing_group":"2 x 375g blocks all-butter puff pastry"},{"ing_group":"flour , for dusting"},{"ing_group":"1 x 320g ready-rolled sheet all-butter puff pastry"},{"ing_group":"2 tbsp breadcrumbs"},{"ing_group":"300g pack cooked beetroot , sliced"},{"ing_group":"450g jar roasted red peppers , drained"},{"ing_group":"200g block feta cheese"},{"ing_group":"150g frozen peas"},{"ing_group":"small bunch each parsley and mint, chopped"},{"ing_group":"10 eggs"},{"ing_group":"2 tbsp sesame seeds"}]

ingr_list: [{"ingr_list":"2 x 200g sponge flan cases (25cm)"},{"ingr_list":"6 tbsp strawberry jam or conserve"},{"ingr_list":"400g strawberries (look for ones that are a similar size), halved"},{"ingr_list":"600ml double cream"},{"ingr_list":"2 tbsp icing sugar , plus 150g"},{"ingr_list":"5 tbsp elderflower cordial"},{"ingr_list":"5-6 raspberries or some pink food colouring gel"},{"ingr_list":"small handful pistachios (optional), slivered or roughly chopped (see tip)"},{"ingr_list":"strawberry coulis or cream, to serve"}]
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Remove the base of a 20cm loose-bottomed cake tin (make sure it’s a deep one) and use it as a template to cut out a circle from each flan case. Chop the offcuts from the flans into small pieces and set aside. Reassemble the tin and line it with a couple of sheets of cling film, leaving enough overhanging to wrap up once the tin is filled."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Put one flan disc in the base of the tin and spread over half the jam. Arrange the strawberries around the outside with the cut surface facing outwards. If you have any particularly large or small strawberries, put them to one side."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Whip the cream, 2 tbsp icing sugar and 3 tbsp elderflower cordial together in a bowl until the mixture holds its shape. Chop the reserved strawberries, then fold them into the cream mixture. Use half of the cream to fill the centre of the gateau, spreading right to the edges so it holds the strawberries in place."},{"meth_group":"STEP 4"},{"meth_group":"Push a single layer of the chopped flan offcuts into the cream (you may have some leftovers to nibble on), and drizzle over the remaining elderflower cordial. Stir the remaining jam through the rest of the cream, spread it over the flan pieces, and top with the final piece of flan. Fold over the cling film and give the gateau a gentle press down to compact the layers. Chill while you make the icing. Can be chilled for up to 24 hrs."},{"meth_group":"STEP 5"},{"meth_group":"Crush the raspberries with the back of a fork and stir in the 150g icing sugar to make a thick icing. Add a splash of water if it’s too thick. Alternatively, add enough water to the icing sugar to make a thick icing, then stir in a few drops of pink food colouring."},{"meth_group":"STEP 6"},{"meth_group":"When you’re ready to serve, remove the cake from the tin and discard the cling film, then transfer to a cake stand. Spread the icing right to the edges, then scatter the pistachios in a ring around the top, if using, and serve with a little strawberry coulis or cream on the side, if you like."}]

meth_list: [{"meth_list":"STEP 1"},{"meth_list":"Put the chicken in a bowl. Pare strips of zest from the lemon using a vegetable peeler, then juice the lemon too. The strips will cook through quickly so don’t leave them too long. Season if you like."},{"meth_list":"STEP 3"},{"meth_list":"Warm the flatbreads on the edge of the barbecue (or on the griddle) for a minute, then transfer them to plates and spread each with ½ tbsp yogurt. ingr_list: [{"ingr_list":"100g butter , melted, plus extra for the tin"},{"ingr_list":"200g digestive biscuits"},{"ingr_list":"2 gelatine leaves"},{"ingr_list":"50g raspberries"},{"ingr_list":"50g caster sugar , plus 2 tbsp"},{"ingr_list":"350g strawberries"},{"ingr_list":"500g full-fat soft cheese"},{"ingr_list":"250ml double cream"},{"ingr_list":"few drops red or pink food colouring"},{"ingr_list":"1 tbsp vanilla bean paste"},{"ingr_list":"50g white chocolate , melted"},{"ingr_list":"few drops lemon extract (optional)"}]
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Butter and line the base and sides of a 20cm springform tin. Blitz the digestives in a food processor until you get fine crumbs, or bash in a sandwich bag with a rolling pin. Transfer to a bowl and stir in the melted butter until it looks like damp sand. Tip into the prepared tin, and smooth the mixture with the back of a spoon to make an even base, then chill."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Soak the gelatine leaves in cold water. Put the raspberries in a food processor or in a jug using a stick blender, and blitz to a smooth purée. Sieve out the seeds. Warm the raspberry sauce in a small pan with 1 tbsp sugar until just starting to steam, then pour over 1 drained gelatine leaf in a bowl and stir to dissolve."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Blitz 3 (about 65g) of the strawberries in a food processor, and warm through with 1 tbsp sugar in the same way. Tip into a bowl and stir in the other drained gelatine leaf."},{"meth_group":"STEP 4"},{"meth_group":"Whisk the soft cheese, cream and caster sugar until it just starts to thicken. Divide between three bowls (about 260g per bowl). Fold the strawberry purée into one with a few drops of food colouring to make it light pink, the raspberry mix with the gelatine into another with more food colouring so it’s dark pink, and the vanilla bean paste into the third."},{"meth_group":"STEP 5"},{"meth_group":"Spoon the raspberry filling over the biscuit base, smoothing the surface so it’s flat. Next, add the strawberry filling, gently smoothing over without disturbing the bottom layer, then repeat with the vanilla mixture, using a clean spoon to level the top. A spatula or knife might help with this to keep from dragging the below layers. Chill for 4 hrs or overnight."},{"meth_group":"STEP 6"},{"meth_group":"Run a knife around the sides of the cake tin between the cheesecake and the parchment, and loosen the base. Transfer to a cake stand, and smooth the sides, using a palette knife, to neaten the layers. Mix the chocolate with a few drops of lemon extract, if using. Pile the remaining strawberries, some sliced, some whole, on top, and drizzle over the chocolate to finish."}]

name: Raspberry cordial

Blitz the digestives in a food processor until you get fine crumbs, or bash in a sandwich bag with a rolling pin. Transfer to a bowl and stir in the melted butter until it looks like damp sand. Put the raspberries in a food processor or in a jug using a stick blender, and blitz to a smooth purée. Sieve out the seeds. Warm the raspberry sauce in a small pan with 1 tbsp sugar until just starting to steam, then pour over 1 drained gelatine leaf in a bowl and stir to dissolve."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Blitz 3 (about 65g) of the strawberries in a food processor, and warm through with 1 tbsp sugar in the same way. Tip into a bowl and stir in the other drained gelatine leaf."},{"meth_group":"STEP 4"},{"meth_group":"Whisk the soft cheese, cream and caster sugar until it just starts to thicken. Divide between three bowls (about 260g per bowl). Fold the strawberry purée into one with a few drops of food colouring to make it light pink, the raspberry mix with the gelatine into another with more food colouring so it’s dark pink, and the vanilla bean paste into the third."},{"meth_group":"STEP 5"},{"meth_group":"Spoon the raspberry filling over the biscuit base, smoothing the surface so it’s flat. Next, add the strawberry filling, gently smoothing over without disturbing the bottom layer, then repeat with the vanilla mixture, using a clean spoon to level the top. A spatula or knife might help with this to keep from dragging the below layers. Chill for 4 hrs or overnight."},{"meth_group":"STEP 6"},{"meth_group":"Run a knife around the sides of the cake tin between the cheesecake and the parchment, and loosen the base. Transfer to a cake stand, and smooth the sides, using a palette knife, to neaten the layers. Mix the chocolate with a few drops of lemon extract, if using. Pile the remaining strawberries, some sliced, some whole, on top, and drizzle over the chocolate to finish."}]
ing_group: [{"ing_group":"100g butter , melted, plus extra for the tin"},{"ing_group":"200g digestive biscuits"},{"ing_group":"2 gelatine leaves"},{"ing_group":"50g raspberries"},{"ing_group":"50g caster sugar , plus 2 tbsp"},{"ing_group":"350g strawberries"},{"ing_group":"500g full-fat soft cheese"},{"ing_group":"250ml double cream"},{"ing_group":"few drops red or pink food colouring"},{"ing_group":"1 tbsp vanilla bean paste"},{"ing_group":"50g white chocolate , melted"},{"ing_group":"few drops lemon extract (optional)"}]

name: Steak & aubergine salad
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Dust the aubergine slices in the flour, mixed with some seasoning. Heat 2 tbsp of the olive oil in a large frying pan until shimmering. Add the aubergine to the pan and fry for a few mins on each side until collapsing and soft, then set aside. Turn up the heat, season the steak, then add to the pan and fry for 2 mins on each side for rare (longer if you want it medium). Set aside to rest for 5 mins, then slice."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Blitz the remaining olive oil in a blender or small food processor with the rest of the dressing ingredients and a splash of water. When ready to serve, mix half the dressing with the lamb’s lettuce, then tip onto a plate. Top with the crispy aubergine and steak, crumble over the feta, then drizzle over the remaining dressing. Scatter over the remaining herbs and serve."}]
ing_group: [{"ing_group":"1 aubergine , halved lengthways, cut into thin slices"},{"ing_group":"2 tbsp flour"},{"ing_group":"3 ½ tbsp olive oil"},{"ing_group":"1 sirloin steak"},{"ing_group":"100g lamb’s lettuce"},{"ing_group":"50g feta , cut into cubes"},{"ing_group":"1 green chilli , halved and chopped"},{"ing_group":"½ lemon , juiced"},{"ing_group":"½small pack coriander , plus extra leaves to serve"},{"ing_group":"½small pack mint , plus extra leaves to serve"}]

ingr_list: [{"ingr_list":"2 x 400g cans coconut milk (not light)"},{"ingr_list":"175g caster sugar"},{"ingr_list":"1 tsp sea salt flakes"},{"ingr_list":"1 vanilla pod or 1 tbsp vanilla bean paste"},{"ingr_list":"2 tbsp cornflour"},{"ingr_list":"a pinch turmeric"}]
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Pour most of the coconut milk into a saucepan, reserving a splash in a small bowl for later. Add the sugar, salt and turmeric (for colour) to the pan. Cut the vanilla pod in half lengthways (if using) and scrape the seeds out of both sides with the side of the knife. Put the seeds and the pod, or vanilla paste, into the pan. Warm on a low heat for 10 mins until the sugar has melted and the mixture starts to steam."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Mix the cornflour with the reserved coconut milk in a small bowl until smooth. Pour into the hot milk, and continually whisking, heat for another 5-10 mins until the mixture thickens to a pourable custard consistency. Strain into a bowl, and cover. Leave to cool, then chill for at least 2 hrs."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Pour the chilled mix into an ice cream maker, and churn for 20-30 mins until you get a soft scoop ice cream. Transfer to a sealable container and freeze for up to 3 months until ready to serve. If you don’t have an ice cream maker, pour the chilled mix into a wide-based plastic tub or dish. Freeze for 2-3 hrs, stirring the mix every 20 mins with a fork, to break up any large ice crystals, until soft ice cream. Transfer to a smaller tub and freeze until ready to serve. You should be able to scoop the ice cream easily from the freezer, or leave for a few mins at room temperature to soften, if you need to."}]
ing_group: [{"ing_group":"2 x 400g cans coconut milk (not light)"},{"ing_group":"175g caster sugar"},{"ing_group":"1 tsp sea salt flakes"},{"ing_group":"1 vanilla pod or 1 tbsp vanilla bean paste"},{"ing_group":"2 tbsp cornflour"},{"ing_group":"a pinch turmeric"}]

ingr_list: [{"ingr_list":"12 chicken thighs , boneless and skinless"},{"ingr_list":"2 tbsp soy sauce"},{"ingr_list":"1 tbsp sesame oil"},{"ingr_list":"thumb-sized piece ginger , grated"},{"ingr_list":"4 spring onions , sliced"},{"ingr_list":"4 tbsp Korean chilli paste (gochujang) or use a mixture of 3 tbsp ketchup and 1 tbsp sriracha chilli sauce"},{"ingr_list":"2 tbsp honey"},{"ingr_list":"juice ½ lime"},{"ingr_list":"1 tbsp soy sauce"},{"ingr_list":"1 tsp sesame oil"},{"ingr_list":"2 tbsp sesame seeds"}]
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Toss the chicken in the soy sauce, sesame oil and ginger. Thread each thigh on two long metal skewers, so that each skewer pierces one side of the thigh. Keep threading the chicken, making sure it’s packed onto the skewers tightly. Chill until you’re ready to cook. Mix the ingredients for the glaze."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Heat the BBQ. If using a coal BBQ, wait for the coals to turn ashen before you start cooking. Cook the kebab for 5-8 mins on each side (depending on the heat). Once nicely charred but not fully cooked through, start painting on the glaze. The honey will catch if cooked for too long – the key to nice sticky chicken is applying the glaze in layers, turning the kebab often."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Once the glaze has been used up and the chicken is cooked through (it’ll take about 20 mins in total), transfer to a plate and leave to cool for 5 mins before serving scattered with spring onions."}]

name: Easy cornflake tart
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Heat the oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Unroll the pastry and briefly roll out on a lightly floured work surface until it's large enough to fit a 23cm loose-bottomed tart tin. Use the rolling pin to lift the pastry over the tin, then press into the corners and sides so the excess pastry hangs over the rim. Trim this away, leaving just a small amount of excess hanging over the rim."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Line the pastry with baking parchment and fill with baking beans or uncooked rice. Bake for 15 mins. Remove the parchment and beans, then bake for another 5-10 mins until just golden. Remove from the oven and trim any excess pastry from the edges using a serrated knife."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Heat the butter, syrup and sugar in a small pan with a pinch of salt, stirring frequently, until melted and smooth. Fold in the cornflakes to coat in the butter mixture."},{"meth_group":"STEP 4"},{"meth_group":"Spoon the jam into the cooked pastry base, then level the surface. Tip the cornflake mixture over the jam and gently press down until all of the jam is covered with a layer of the mixture. Return the tart to the oven and bake for another 5 mins until the cornflakes are golden and toasted. Leave to cool until just warm before slicing and serving with custard."}]

ingr_list: [{"ingr_list":"2 skinless chicken breasts , cut into strips"},{"ingr_list":"1 lemon"},{"ingr_list":"1 tsp dried oregano (optional)"},{"ingr_list":"1 garlic clove , crushed"},{"ingr_list":"pinch of cinnamon"},{"ingr_list":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingr_list":"4 flatbreads"},{"ingr_list":"4 tbsp Greek yogurt"},{"ingr_list":"¼ red pepper , finely chopped"},{"ingr_list":"1 Little Gem lettuce , finely chopped"}]
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Put the chicken in a bowl. Pare strips of zest from the lemon using a vegetable peeler, then juice the lemon too. Add the peel and half the juice to the chicken, along with the oregano (if using), garlic, cinnamon and oil. Mix well, cover and chill for an hour. The lemon juice will start to ‘cook’ the chicken, so don’t leave for longer."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Heat the barbecue. If you are using coals, wait until they turn white. If you are indoors, heat a griddle pan. Thread the chicken strips onto a couple of metal skewers to stop them falling through the grate (you don’t need to do this for the griddle), then grill for a couple of mins each side. The strips will cook through quickly so don’t leave them too long. Season if you like."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Warm the flatbreads on the edge of the barbecue (or on the griddle) for a minute, then transfer them to plates and spread each with ½ tbsp yogurt. Divide the chicken strips between them, then dot on the remaining yogurt and sprinkle over the pepper and lettuce. Fold or roll the flatbreads to eat."}]

name: Roasted asparagus & pea salad
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Heat oven to 220C/200C fan/gas 7. Mix the yogurt, mustard and honey together. Add the lemon zest, then add the juice and some seasoning to taste. name: Korean chilli, sesame & honey chicken
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Toss the chicken in the soy sauce, sesame oil and ginger. Thread each thigh on two long metal skewers, so that each skewer pierces one side of the thigh. Keep threading the chicken, making sure it’s packed onto the skewers tightly. Chill until you’re ready to cook. Mix the ingredients for the glaze."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Heat the BBQ. If using a coal BBQ, wait for the coals to turn ashen before you start cooking. Cook the kebab for 5-8 mins on each side (depending on the heat). Once nicely charred but not fully cooked through, start painting on the glaze. The honey will catch if cooked for too long – the key to nice sticky chicken is applying the glaze in layers, turning the kebab often."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Once the glaze has been used up and the chicken is cooked through (it’ll take about 20 mins in total), transfer to a plate and leave to cool for 5 mins before serving scattered with spring onions."}]
ing_group: [{"ing_group":"12 chicken thighs , boneless and skinless"},{"ing_group":"2 tbsp soy sauce"},{"ing_group":"1 tbsp sesame oil"},{"ing_group":"thumb-sized piece ginger , grated"},{"ing_group":"4 spring onions , sliced"},{"ing_group":"4 tbsp Korean chilli paste (gochujang) or use a mixture of 3 tbsp ketchup and 1 tbsp sriracha chilli sauce"},{"ing_group":"2 tbsp honey"},{"ing_group":"juice ½ lime"},{"ing_group":"1 tbsp soy sauce"},{"ing_group":"1 tsp sesame oil"},{"ing_group":"2 tbsp sesame seeds"}]

ingr_list: [{"ingr_list":"120ml double cream"},{"ingr_list":"120ml milk"},{"ingr_list":"3 ⅓ sheets gelatine (the sheets are easy to snap into thirds)"},{"ingr_list":"5 egg yolks (freeze the whites for meringues)"},{"ingr_list":"15g golden caster sugar"},{"ingr_list":"pinch salt"},{"ingr_list":"200g white chocolate , chopped"},{"ingr_list":"60g butter , chopped"},{"ingr_list":"200g frozen petits pois , defrosted"},{"ingr_list":"pea shoots and edible flowers, to decorate"}]
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Put the cream and milk in a pan and heat slowly until almost boiling. Soak the gelatine in cold water until floppy."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Put the egg yolks in a bowl with the sugar and whisk together with the salt. Pour the milk mixture over the yolks, then pour the lot back into the pan (give it a wipe first to clean the bottom) and stir the mixture over a low heat until it starts to thicken and make a thin custard. Keep stirring and don’t turn the heat up too high or the eggs might start to cook into clumps."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Turn off the heat and stir in the gelatine, chocolate and butter then, once incorporated, stir in the peas. Whizz in a blender until it is as fine as you can get it, then pour it through a sieve into a jug. Either chill in a box or divide the mixture between glasses and chill them. If you’ve chilled the mixture in a box, spoon or pipe it into glasses to serve and decorate with pea shoots and flowers."}]

meth_list: [{"meth_list":"STEP 1"},{"meth_list":"Put the potatoes in a pan of cold salted water and bring to the boil. Simmer for 15 mins or until tender and a knife goes in easily. Drain the potatoes and return to the pan, then stand for 5-10 mins to steam-dry. Cut them into bite-sized pieces, season with salt, cover and chill until cold."},{"meth_list":"STEP 2"},{"meth_list":"Heat the barbecue (or heat a griddle pan if cooking indoors). Halve each large chorizo lengthways and put them, cut-side down, on the barbecue (small chorizo can go on whole). Cook, turning once or twice, until they are crisp around the edges and cooked through. Slice the chorizo into pieces."},{"meth_list":"STEP 3"},{"meth_list":"Combine the soured cream, mayonnaise and mustard, then add to the cold potatoes with the celery and dill. Gently fold the potatoes into the dressing, taking care not to break up them too much. Scatter the chorizo on top to serve."}]

ing_group: [{"ing_group":"750g new potatoes , halved if large"},{"ing_group":"4-6 large cooking  chorizo (or 12 small ones)"},{"ing_group":"150ml soured cream"},{"ing_group":"3 tbsp mayonnaise"},{"ing_group":"1 tsp Dijon mustard"},{"ing_group":"1 celery stalk , finely diced (optional)"},{"ing_group":"1 tbsp dill , very finely chopped"}]

meth_list: [{"meth_list":"STEP 1"},{"meth_list":"Remove the base of a 20cm loose-bottomed cake tin (make sure it’s a deep one) and use it as a template to cut out a circle from each flan case. Chop the offcuts from the flans into small pieces and set aside. Reassemble the tin and line it with a couple of sheets of cling film, leaving enough overhanging to wrap up once the tin is filled."},{"meth_list":"STEP 2"},{"meth_list":"Put one flan disc in the base of the tin and spread over half the jam. Arrange the strawberries around the outside with the cut surface facing outwards. If you have any particularly large or small strawberries, put them to one side."},{"meth_list":"STEP 3"},{"meth_list":"Whip the cream, 2 tbsp icing sugar and 3 tbsp elderflower cordial together in a bowl until the mixture holds its shape. Chop the reserved strawberries, then fold them into the cream mixture. Use half of the cream to fill the centre of the gateau, spreading right to the edges so it holds the strawberries in place."},{"meth_list":"STEP 4"},{"meth_list":"Push a single layer of the chopped flan offcuts into the cream (you may have some leftovers to nibble on), and drizzle over the remaining elderflower cordial. Stir the remaining jam through the rest of the cream, spread it over the flan pieces, and top with the final piece of flan. Fold over the cling film and give the gateau a gentle press down to compact the layers. Chill while you make the icing. Can be chilled for up to 24 hrs."},{"meth_list":"STEP 5"},{"meth_list":"Crush the raspberries with the back of a fork and stir in the 150g icing sugar to make a thick icing. Add a splash of water if it’s too thick. Alternatively, add enough water to the icing sugar to make a thick icing, then stir in a few drops of pink food colouring."},{"meth_list":"STEP 6"},{"meth_list":"When you’re ready to serve, remove the cake from the tin and discard the cling film, then transfer to a cake stand. Spread the icing right to the edges, then scatter the pistachios in a ring around the top, if using, and serve with a little strawberry coulis or cream on the side, if you like."}]

name: Summer fruit & mascarpone tart
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Unroll 1 pastry sheet, but leave it on the parchment. Place it on a baking tray, dust with 2 tbsp icing sugar, then cover with another sheet of parchment and another baking tray. Pour baking beans into the tray to weigh it down, or use empty cans. Bake for 30 mins, then check if the pastry is golden all over. If not, return for another 5 mins or so. Repeat with the other pastry sheet (or cook both together if you have enough trays). Once out of the oven, trim the edges with a large, sharp knife. Leave to cool."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Softly whip the mascarpone, cream, vanilla and remaining icing sugar, then transfer half to a disposable piping bag fitted with a 1.5cm round nozzle (or just snip off the corner). Pipe blobs of the mascarpone cream over the surface of one piece of pastry, right up to the edges. Top with half the fruit and dust with a little icing sugar."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Top with the second piece of pastry, more mascarpone cream (refilling the bag when you need to), the remaining fruit, a dusting of icing sugar and, finally, some mint leaves. Use a serrated knife to cut through the layers without squashing the whole tart. Best served within an hour or two, but leftovers will keep for up to two days in the fridge."}]
ing_group: [{"ing_group":"2 x 320g ready-rolled all-butter puff pastry"},{"ing_group":"100g icing sugar"},{"ing_group":"750g tub mascarpone"},{"ing_group":"600ml double cream"},{"ing_group":"2 tsp vanilla extract"},{"ing_group":"200g raspberries , a few halved"},{"ing_group":"200g blackberries , a few halved"},{"ing_group":"1 large mango , peeled and thinly sliced"},{"ing_group":"6 nectarines or peaches, or a mixture, sliced"},{"ing_group":"4 passion fruits (look for ones with crinkly skin, this means they’re ripe), halved, seeds and pulp scooped out"},{"ing_group":"handful small mint leaves"}]

name: Slow-roasted courgettes with fennel & orzo
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Put the saffron in a small bowl and cover with 1/2 tbsp of boiling water. Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Put the fennel in a roasting tin with the tomatoes and bay leaf, drizzle over some oil, season and toss together with the chilli flakes. Pour over the wine. Prick the courgettes all over with a fork and place on top of the fennel. Drizzle with a little more oil, then season and cover with foil."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Roast for 1 1/2 - 2 hrs, turning the courgettes halfway through, removing the foil for the last 5 mins. The courgettes should be very soft. Lift the courgettes from the pan and set aside."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Meanwhile, heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a frying pan over a medium heat. Add half the lemon zest and breadcrumbs, and gently fry until the bread is golden and crunchy. Set aside."},{"meth_group":"STEP 4"},{"meth_group":"Cook the orzo in a pan of boiling water until al dente, then drain. Toss with the fennel, tomatoes, pine nuts, the saffron and its water. Season."},{"meth_group":"STEP 5"},{"meth_group":"Divide the orzo between plates and add half the ricotta to each, drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with sea salt. Top with the courgettes and scatter over the breadcrumbs, remaining lemon zest and sprigs of dill."}]

recip: Mashed cannellini beans with wilted greens & fried artichokes
ingr_list: [{"ingr_list":"4 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingr_list":"1 garlic clove , crushed"},{"ingr_list":"2 thyme sprigs"},{"ingr_list":"pinch of red chilli flakes"},{"ingr_list":"400g can cannellini beans , drained, 1 tbsp of can water reserved"},{"ingr_list":"1 lemon , zested and juiced, plus wedges to serve"},{"ingr_list":"200g mixed seasonal greens (I used spinach, watercress, sorrel and rocket)"},{"ingr_list":"2 tbsp semolina flour"},{"ingr_list":"100g cooked artichoke hearts , in oil"},{"ingr_list":"few rosemary sprigs , finely chopped (optional)"},{"ingr_list":"parmesan or vegetarian alternative, to serve"}]
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Warm 1 tbsp olive oil in a saucepan over a medium heat. Add the garlic, thyme, a pinch of salt and the chilli flakes, and cook for 1 min or so. Tip in the beans, then add a slosh of their water and the juice of 1/2 a lemon. Cook for a few mins, crushing them with a fork or the back of a wooden spoon. Remove from the heat and discard the springs of thyme. Keep warm."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Heat a little olive oil in a non-stick frying pan with a lid. Add the greens and a pinch of salt, then put the lid on to wilt and steam the greens for a few mins until softened. Season and add some of the lemon juice, and tip into a bowl. Keep warm."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in the frying pan you used for the greens. Put the semolina flour in a bowl and season. Drain the artichokes and pat them dry with kitchen paper. Dip each one in the flour and put in the pan to shallow fry, turning halfway through, until crisp and golden, around 3-5 mins. Spoon the cannellini beans onto a plate and top with the wilted greens and artichokes. Garnish with lemon zest, rosemary, grated parmesan and extra lemon wedges on the side."}]

ingr_list: [{"ingr_list":"2 x 320g ready-rolled all-butter puff pastry"},{"ingr_list":"100g icing sugar"},{"ingr_list":"750g tub mascarpone"},{"ingr_list":"600ml double cream"},{"ingr_list":"2 tsp vanilla extract"},{"ingr_list":"200g raspberries , a few halved"},{"ingr_list":"200g blackberries , a few halved"},{"ingr_list":"1 large mango , peeled and thinly sliced"},{"ingr_list":"6 nectarines or peaches, or a mixture, sliced"},{"ingr_list":"4 passion fruits (look for ones with crinkly skin, this means they’re ripe), halved, seeds and pulp scooped out"},{"ingr_list":"handful small mint leaves"}]
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Unroll 1 pastry sheet, but leave it on the parchment. Place it on a baking tray, dust with 2 tbsp icing sugar, then cover with another sheet of parchment and another baking tray. Pour baking beans into the tray to weigh it down, or use empty cans. Bake for 30 mins, then check if the pastry is golden all over. If not, return for another 5 mins or so. Repeat with the other pastry sheet (or cook both together if you have enough trays). Once out of the oven, trim the edges with a large, sharp knife. Leave to cool."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Softly whip the mascarpone, cream, vanilla and remaining icing sugar, then transfer half to a disposable piping bag fitted with a 1.5cm round nozzle (or just snip off the corner). Pipe blobs of the mascarpone cream over the surface of one piece of pastry, right up to the edges. Top with half the fruit and dust with a little icing sugar."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Top with the second piece of pastry, more mascarpone cream (refilling the bag when you need to), the remaining fruit, a dusting of icing sugar and, finally, some mint leaves. Use a serrated knife to cut through the layers without squashing the whole tart. Best served within an hour or two, but leftovers will keep for up to two days in the fridge."}]

recip: Griddled halloumi with watermelon & caper breadcrumbs
ingr_list: [{"ingr_list":"750g watermelon"},{"ingr_list":"2 small shallots , very finely sliced"},{"ingr_list":"100ml extra virgin olive oil , plus extra for brushing and to serve"},{"ingr_list":"4 tsp white balsamic vinegar"},{"ingr_list":"300g halloumi , sliced"},{"ingr_list":"good squeeze of lemon juice"},{"ingr_list":"75g slightly stale country bread , crusts removed, blitzed into coarse breadcrumbs"},{"ingr_list":"1-2 cloves garlic , finely chopped"},{"ingr_list":"½ medium red chilli , halved, deseeded and chopped"},{"ingr_list":"2½ tbsp capers , rinsed"},{"ingr_list":"50g blanched almonds , toasted and chopped"},{"ingr_list":"small bunch of mint , leaves picked, half of them torn"}]
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Cut the watermelon into either cubes or slices and transfer to a bowl with the shallots. Add 4 tbsp extra virgin olive oil and the balsamic, then season with fresh black pepper. Cover and put in the fridge for about 15-20 mins."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Heat the remaining oil in a frying pan. Fry the breadcrumbs until turning gold. Add the garlic, chilli and capers and cook for another minute, then toss in the almonds. Remove from the heat, add the torn mint (it will wilt a little), then taste – it will be quite salty, but the watermelon won’t be, so you’ll get a good contrast."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Brush the halloumi with a little oil and heat a griddle pan. Griddle the cheese on both sides until just starting to melt but still holding its shape, with nice golden griddle marks. Toss the cold watermelon and shallots with the rest of the mint leaves and some salt. Divide between four plates, or pile onto a platter. Put the hot halloumi on top. Squeeze over some lemon juice and top with some of the breadcrumb and caper mix. Serve immediately."}]

name: Strawberry & elderflower gateau
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Remove the base of a 20cm loose-bottomed cake tin (make sure it’s a deep one) and use it as a template to cut out a circle from each flan case. Chop the offcuts from the flans into small pieces and set aside. Reassemble the tin and line it with a couple of sheets of cling film, leaving enough overhanging to wrap up once the tin is filled."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Put one flan disc in the base of the tin and spread over half the jam. Arrange the strawberries around the outside with the cut surface facing outwards. If you have any particularly large or small strawberries, put them to one side."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Whip the cream, 2 tbsp icing sugar and 3 tbsp elderflower cordial together in a bowl until the mixture holds its shape. Chop the reserved strawberries, then fold them into the cream mixture. Use half of the cream to fill the centre of the gateau, spreading right to the edges so it holds the strawberries in place."},{"meth_group":"STEP 4"},{"meth_group":"Push a single layer of the chopped flan offcuts into the cream (you may have some leftovers to nibble on), and drizzle over the remaining elderflower cordial. Stir the remaining jam through the rest of the cream, spread it over the flan pieces, and top with the final piece of flan. Fold over the cling film and give the gateau a gentle press down to compact the layers. Chill while you make the icing. Can be chilled for up to 24 hrs."},{"meth_group":"STEP 5"},{"meth_group":"Crush the raspberries with the back of a fork and stir in the 150g icing sugar to make a thick icing. Add a splash of water if it’s too thick. Alternatively, add enough water to the icing sugar to make a thick icing, then stir in a few drops of pink food colouring."},{"meth_group":"STEP 6"},{"meth_group":"When you’re ready to serve, remove the cake from the tin and discard the cling film, then transfer to a cake stand. Spread the icing right to the edges, then scatter the pistachios in a ring around the top, if using, and serve with a little strawberry coulis or cream on the side, if you like."}]

name: Smashed chicken with corn slaw

recip: Swedish meatballs with beetroot & apple salad
name: Swedish meatballs with beetroot & apple salad
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"To make the meatballs, tip the pork into a bowl and add the grated courgette and onion, half the dill, half the garlic and plenty of black pepper. Break in the egg and mix well with your hands. When everything is well combined, break off walnut-size pieces and roll into balls – you should end up with about 28. The mixture will be very soft."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Heat the oil in a large non-stick frying pan then gently fry the meatballs in two batches until firm and pale golden, turning them every now and then so they brown evenly. Each batch should take 6-8 mins."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Wipe out the pan to remove excess fat and add the remaining garlic and thyme, then pour in the bouillon and bring to the boil. Turn off the heat, stir in the crème fraîche and remaining dill, then return the meatballs to the pan and turn them in the mixture until coated."},{"meth_group":"STEP 4"},{"meth_group":"For the salad, mix the apple, onion, parsley and capers with the lemon, then stir through the beetroot. Serve the salad alongside the meatballs. If you’re cooking for two people, eat half the meatballs and salad now, and chill the rest for another day – it will keep in the fridge for up to three days. Reheat the meatballs in the microwave until piping hot."}]
ing_group: [{"ing_group":"500g lean pork mince (5% fat)"},{"ing_group":"100g coarsely grated courgette , squeezed of excess juice"},{"ing_group":"1 onion , grated"},{"ing_group":"4 tbsp chopped fresh dill"},{"ing_group":"2 garlic cloves , finely grated"},{"ing_group":"1 egg"},{"ing_group":"1 tbsp rapeseed oil"},{"ing_group":"1 tsp thyme leaves"},{"ing_group":"2 tsp vegetable bouillon powder , made up to 300ml with boiling water"},{"ing_group":"2 tbsp half-fat crème fraîche"},{"ing_group":"1 large apple , chopped"},{"ing_group":"1 red onion , halved and thinly sliced"},{"ing_group":"4 tbsp chopped parsley"},{"ing_group":"2 tsp capers"},{"ing_group":"½ lemon , juiced"},{"ing_group":"320g cooked beetroot , cut into strips"}]

ingr_list: [{"ingr_list":"100g unsalted butter , softened"},{"ingr_list":"450g strong white bread flour"},{"ingr_list":"7g sachet fast-action dried yeast"},{"ingr_list":"1 tsp golden caster sugar"},{"ingr_list":"rapeseed oil , for the bowl and tray"},{"ingr_list":"2 tbsp polenta or cornmeal"},{"ingr_list":"1 garlic clove , grated"},{"ingr_list":"100g mozzarella , grated"},{"ingr_list":"50g cheddar , grated"}]
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Heat 280ml water in a saucepan for a minute until warm but not too hot to stick your finger in (don’t burn yourself!). Remove from the heat, then add 50g butter. Combine the flour, yeast, sugar and 1 tsp salt in a large bowl or a tabletop mixer. Add the warm water and beat to make a soft dough. Knead for 10 mins by hand, or 5 mins in a mixer, until the dough feels stretchy and smooth. Tip into a clean, oiled bowl and cover with oiled cling film. Leave to rise for 1½-2 hrs, or until doubled in size."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Brush a large baking tray with oil and scatter over the polenta. Knock the air out of the dough. Pinch off small pieces (about the size of a walnut), then roll each piece into a ball and put on the baking tray. Leave a little space between each dough ball."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Cover the tray with oiled cling film, then prove for 30 mins-1 hr until the dough has doubled in size and the balls are touching. Mix the remaining butter with the garlic. When the rolls are ready to cook, brush the tops with the garlic butter and scatter with the cheeses. Bake for 25-30 mins until the dough balls are cooked through. Leave to cool for 5 mins, then serve."}]
ing_group: [{"ing_group":"100g unsalted butter , softened"},{"ing_group":"450g strong white bread flour"},{"ing_group":"7g sachet fast-action dried yeast"},{"ing_group":"1 tsp golden caster sugar"},{"ing_group":"rapeseed oil , for the bowl and tray"},{"ing_group":"2 tbsp polenta or cornmeal"},{"ing_group":"1 garlic clove , grated"},{"ing_group":"100g mozzarella , grated"},{"ing_group":"50g cheddar , grated"}]

name: Campfire smoky bean brekkie
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Heat the oil in a large paella pan (ours was 45cm). Add the rosemary and sizzle for a minute or 2, then scoop it out to a plate and set aside. name: Mozzarella sticks
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Cut the mozzarella into ‘chips’. Tip the flour into a bowl and season well. Whisk the eggs in a second bowl and tip the breadcrumbs, paprika and oregano into a third. Coat the mozzarella sticks in the flour, then the egg, then the breadcrumbs. Transfer to a parchment-lined tray and freeze for at least 2 hrs."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Heat enough oil to come 2-3cm up the side of a saucepan. Cook the chips in batches and drain on kitchen paper. Serve hot with your favourite dip."}]

name: Tear-and-share cheese & garlic rolls
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Heat 280ml water in a saucepan for a minute until warm but not too hot to stick your finger in (don’t burn yourself!). Leave to rise for 1½-2 hrs, or until doubled in size."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Brush a large baking tray with oil and scatter over the polenta. Knock the air out of the dough. When the rolls are ready to cook, brush the tops with the garlic butter and scatter with the cheeses. Bake for 25-30 mins until the dough balls are cooked through. Leave to cool for 5 mins, then serve."}]

meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Hard boil the eggs by cooking them in boiling water for 8 mins, then cool quickly under cold running water and peel. Spoon or pipe the mixture back into the egg halves and chill until you need them."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Flake the cooked salmon into large chunks and put it on a platter with the hot-smoked salmon and the eggs."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Spread the bottom half of the rolls with cream cheese, then add the smoked salmon and a squeeze of lemon juice and top with the other half of the roll. name: Vegan vanilla ice cream
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Pour most of the coconut milk into a saucepan, reserving a splash in a small bowl for later. Add the sugar, salt and turmeric (for colour) to the pan. Cut the vanilla pod in half lengthways (if using) and scrape the seeds out of both sides with the side of the knife. Put the seeds and the pod, or vanilla paste, into the pan. Warm on a low heat for 10 mins until the sugar has melted and the mixture starts to steam."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Mix the cornflour with the reserved coconut milk in a small bowl until smooth. Pour into the hot milk, and continually whisking, heat for another 5-10 mins until the mixture thickens to a pourable custard consistency. Strain into a bowl, and cover. Leave to cool, then chill for at least 2 hrs."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Pour the chilled mix into an ice cream maker, and churn for 20-30 mins until you get a soft scoop ice cream. Transfer to a sealable container and freeze for up to 3 months until ready to serve. If you don’t have an ice cream maker, pour the chilled mix into a wide-based plastic tub or dish. Freeze for 2-3 hrs, stirring the mix every 20 mins with a fork, to break up any large ice crystals, until soft ice cream. Transfer to a smaller tub and freeze until ready to serve. You should be able to scoop the ice cream easily from the freezer, or leave for a few mins at room temperature to soften, if you need to."}]
ing_group: [{"ing_group":"2 x 400g cans coconut milk (not light)"},{"ing_group":"175g caster sugar"},{"ing_group":"1 tsp sea salt flakes"},{"ing_group":"1 vanilla pod or 1 tbsp vanilla bean paste"},{"ing_group":"2 tbsp cornflour"},{"ing_group":"a pinch turmeric"}]

ingr_list: [{"ingr_list":"2 tbsp fat-free yogurt"},{"ingr_list":"1 tbsp mayonnaise"},{"ingr_list":"1 small  garlic clove , grated"},{"ingr_list":"½ tbsp vegetable oil"},{"ingr_list":"2 lamb burgers"},{"ingr_list":"2 sesame seed burger buns"},{"ingr_list":"1 tomato , sliced"},{"ingr_list":"20g gherkins , sliced"},{"ingr_list":"1 red chilli , finely sliced"},{"ingr_list":"leaves of 1 Baby Gem lettuce"}]

recip: Mashed cannellini beans with wilted greens & fried artichokes
meth_list: [{"meth_list":"STEP 1"},{"meth_list":"Warm 1 tbsp olive oil in a saucepan over a medium heat. Add the garlic, thyme, a pinch of salt and the chilli flakes, and cook for 1 min or so. Tip in the beans, then add a slosh of their water and the juice of 1/2 a lemon. Cook for a few mins, crushing them with a fork or the back of a wooden spoon. Remove from the heat and discard the springs of thyme. Keep warm."},{"meth_list":"STEP 2"},{"meth_list":"Heat a little olive oil in a non-stick frying pan with a lid. Add the greens and a pinch of salt, then put the lid on to wilt and steam the greens for a few mins until softened. Season and add some of the lemon juice, and tip into a bowl. Keep warm."},{"meth_list":"STEP 3"},{"meth_list":"Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in the frying pan you used for the greens. Put the semolina flour in a bowl and season. Drain the artichokes and pat them dry with kitchen paper. Dip each one in the flour and put in the pan to shallow fry, turning halfway through, until crisp and golden, around 3-5 mins. Spoon the cannellini beans onto a plate and top with the wilted greens and artichokes. Garnish with lemon zest, rosemary, grated parmesan and extra lemon wedges on the side."}]

meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Put the peach halves in a gratin dish in a single layer without too much space around them (otherwise the apple juice will simply reduce and burn)."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Crush the pistachios roughly using a pestle and mortar, then mix in the lemon zest, sugar, egg and 1 tsp orange blossom water. Fill the cavity of each peach with this stuffing, mounding it over the top if you have too much."},{"meth_group":"STEP 3"},{"meth_group":"Mix the apple juice with the rest of the orange blossom water and pour it around the peaches. Bake for 30-45 mins, depending on ripeness. The peaches should be tender and slightly caramelised on the top."},{"meth_group":"STEP 4"},{"meth_group":"Whip the cream until it holds its shape, then add the orange zest and sugar, and taste for sweetness. Stir in 1/2 tsp of the orange blossom water and taste. Add more if you like, but be careful not to make the cream too perfumed."},{"meth_group":"STEP 5"},{"meth_group":"Serve the peaches at room temperature, with a little icing sugar sifted on top, some of the cooking juices spooned around and the cream on the side."}]

meth_list: [{"meth_list":"STEP 1"},{"meth_list":"Pour most of the coconut milk into a saucepan, reserving a splash in a small bowl for later. Add the sugar, salt and turmeric (for colour) to the pan. Cut the vanilla pod in half lengthways (if using) and scrape the seeds out of both sides with the side of the knife. Put the seeds and the pod, or vanilla paste, into the pan. Warm on a low heat for 10 mins until the sugar has melted and the mixture starts to steam."},{"meth_list":"STEP 2"},{"meth_list":"Mix the cornflour with the reserved coconut milk in a small bowl until smooth. Pour into the hot milk, and continually whisking, heat for another 5-10 mins until the mixture thickens to a pourable custard consistency. Strain into a bowl, and cover. Leave to cool, then chill for at least 2 hrs."},{"meth_list":"STEP 3"},{"meth_list":"Pour the chilled mix into an ice cream maker, and churn for 20-30 mins until you get a soft scoop ice cream. Transfer to a sealable container and freeze for up to 3 months until ready to serve. If you don’t have an ice cream maker, pour the chilled mix into a wide-based plastic tub or dish. Freeze for 2-3 hrs, stirring the mix every 20 mins with a fork, to break up any large ice crystals, until soft ice cream. Transfer to a smaller tub and freeze until ready to serve. You should be able to scoop the ice cream easily from the freezer, or leave for a few mins at room temperature to soften, if you need to."}]

meth_list: [{"meth_list":"STEP 1"},{"meth_list":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Line 12 holes in a shallow muffin tin with cupcake cases (not muffin cases). recip: Sweet potatoes with red pepper & halloumi
meth_list: [{"meth_list":"STEP 1"},{"meth_list":"Rub each potato with a little oil and salt, then wrap in a double layer of foil."},{"meth_list":"STEP 2"},{"meth_list":"Pour the oil into a bowl and stir in the mint. Add the halloumi and toss until well coated in the minty oil. Wrap each piece in a strip of pepper. Cut four lengths of foil about 1cm wide and wrap one around the middle of each parcel to hold them together. You could use skewers instead, but be careful not to split the cheese."},{"meth_list":"STEP 3"},{"meth_list":"Heat the barbecue. When the coals glow red, put the potatoes directly on them. Cook for 30 mins, turning halfway. Unwrap a potato and check if it is cooked through. If not, rewrap and cook more, checking every 10 mins. Alternatively, bake in the oven at 200C/180C fan/gas 6 for 50 mins-1 hr."},{"meth_list":"STEP 4"},{"meth_list":"Meanwhile cook the pepper parcels on the barbecue or a griddle pan for 3-4 mins each side or until the pepper chars and the cheese melts a bit. Remove from the grill and unwind the foil or remove the skewers. Split the potatoes, add butter if you like, then lay a parcel in the centre of each. Add a squeeze of lemon and scatter over some parsley to serve."}]

ingr_list: [{"ingr_list":"400g block mozzarella (not in water)"},{"ingr_list":"50g flour"},{"ingr_list":"2 eggs"},{"ingr_list":"150g breadcrumbs"},{"ingr_list":"2 tsp smoked paprika"},{"ingr_list":"2 tsp dried oregano"},{"ingr_list":"vegetable or sunflower oil for frying"},{"ingr_list":"dips , to serve"}]
meth_group: [{"meth_group":"STEP 1"},{"meth_group":"Cut the mozzarella into ‘chips’. Tip the flour into a bowl and season well. Whisk the eggs in a second bowl and tip the breadcrumbs, paprika and oregano into a third. Coat the mozzarella sticks in the flour, then the egg, then the breadcrumbs. Transfer to a parchment-lined tray and freeze for at least 2 hrs."},{"meth_group":"STEP 2"},{"meth_group":"Heat enough oil to come 2-3cm up the side of a saucepan. When hot, drop in a test chip – it should sizzle straight away and brown within a minute or two. The secret is to cook them long enough to crisp up the outside without letting the mozzarella ooze out – it may take you a few practice chips to get it right. Cook the chips in batches and drain on kitchen paper. Serve hot with your favourite dip."}]

meth_list: [{"meth_list":"STEP 1"},{"meth_list":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. meth_list: [{"meth_list":"STEP 1"},{"meth_list":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Toss the squash in 1 tbsp oil and some seasoning and roast for 20 mins until soft. Meanwhile, fry the onion in the remaining oil for 10-15 mins over a low heat until golden and boil the potatoes for 8 mins until soft. Drain the potatoes and leave the veg to cool."},{"meth_list":"STEP 2"},{"meth_list":"Reduce oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Line a 20cm x 30cm baking tin with a long double thickness strip of parchment (this will help you to lift out the pie once cooked). Squeeze the two blocks of pastry together, then roll out on a floured surface – the pastry should be about the thickness of a £1 coin. Use the pastry to line the tin, leaving any excess pastry hanging over the edges."},{"meth_list":"STEP 3"},{"meth_list":"Sprinkle the breadcrumbs over the base of the pastry. Layer in the beetroot slices, peppers, squash, onions, feta, potatoes, peas and herbs (in that order for a nice rainbow effect), seasoning well between each layer. Beat the eggs and pour slowly over the filling until most of it has sunk through the layers, saving a little to glaze the top. Brush some egg over the overhanging pastry then lay the rolled pastry sheet on top. Press the pastry sheets together, then use some kitchen scissors to trim the excess pastry, leaving about 2cm. Roll the edges in to seal, then press them firmly with a fork. Brush with egg, sprinkle with seeds, then use the fork prongs to mark out 12 portions. Bake for 1 hr 20 mins until the pastry is golden and crisp. Leave to cool completely before slicing, or chill for up to two days before serving."}]
